reviews.review:
드디어 나의 작은 빡대가리로 엔딩을 보았다. 처음 플레이 했을때는 저 차가운 하얀 깡통들이 뭐가 좋길래 다들 추천을 하는거지 라고 생각했다.
가끔 퍼즐이 막힐때는 현타가 잠시 머물지만 어느새 더 어려운 퍼즐이 나오기를 내심 기대하고 있는 변태같은 나의 모습 또한 포탈2를 하면서 발견할 수 있었다....
 이 게임의 장점은 무엇보다도, 엔딩을 보았을 때 내가 비로소 이 세상의 모든 퍼즐을 풀 수 있을거란 자신감을 심어준다는 사실이다.
이 게임의 허점은 물론 이러한 자신감은 병ㅅ ㅣㄴ 같다는 것이다. 

자존감 없는 이에게 추천.

 그러니 밸브는 더 어려운 게임 가져와라.

It was a great game for my girlfriend to learn FPS with since there is almost 0 need for twitch reflexes.
Glados's character/comments were a surprise to sure, but a welcome one.

There aren't many hours of gameplay (including the many co-op levels) but that is pretty typical for FPS so I can't really hold that against it.

I love it, one of my favorites ever.

Portal 2 is an excellent first person puzzle game. It has the interesting mechanic of using actual portals to solve puzzles designed around it, which are fun and interesting to think out of. The game has a surprisingly good amount of length to it (especially compared to the first game) and, despite using the same mechanics throughout, didn't feel stale. All the while, you're treated to a nice story that's easy to get invested in while also pretty dang funny at the same time. 
Portal's main story can carry it on its own, but one thing I LOVE about Portal 2 is its level editor. Sure, you can spend the time to make your own levels and that's cool, but the real prize here is that there are a TON of great test chambers made by people. If you want unlimited Portal puzzles, this is a pretty darn good deal. 
Portal 2 also has a multiplayer mode where you have to solve portal puzzles...but also while having to use four portals and maneuvering two people. It can be rather tough and fun not only to figure out puzzles, but just getting a friend to cooperate. The multiplayer story isn't going to drag you in, but the stages are well-designed and, of course, the level editor bonus extends to this as well. 
With a great base for singleplayer and multiplayer alongside a ton of additional levels for both from fans, it's very hard to not recommend this.

Portal 1 and Portal 2 are, in my opinion, some of Valve's most well-written and enjoyable games, and perhaps some of the best in the world. If you haven't played either of the Portal games, do yourself a favor and click the "Add to cart" button right now; Portal 2 is practically a rite of passage in the world of PC gaming. With both a singleplayer and co-op campaign in addition to a crapton of custom maps, you'll find plenty of opportunities to think with portals.

10/10
